result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose Angel Sevilla

defendant.name: Sevilla, Jose Angel
defendant.address: 1656 South Cesar E Chavez Drive, Milwaukee, WI 53204

records.addlTxt:
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. 
Defendant Jose Angel Sevilla appeared by video.  Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt appeared by video for Jose Angel Sevilla.  Attorney Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense requests a date for plea and sentencing.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 10-21-22

Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt in court for Jose Angel Sevilla.  Prosecuting attorney Amanda Korin Kirklewski in court for the State of Wisconsin. HEARING HELD OFF THE RECORD. Attorney Schoenfeldt appeared and requested this matter be adjourned. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jose Angel Sevilla in court, appear by video with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt, appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Officer J.Gleesing.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 069592,
Payable Number: 1021669,
Receipt Number: 22RP029741,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Jose Angel Sevilla in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Case in court for a Preliminary Hearing. State's witness is unavailable. State requests an adjournment. Defense move to dismiss. Court denies defense motion and ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Jose Angel Sevilla in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Defendant Jose Angel Sevilla in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jose Angel Sevilla appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
